hook.text: Sprint merged with Nextel for $35 billion. They spent more time fighting each other than competing.

buildup.text: Sprint was corporate and bureaucratic. Nextel was scrappy and entrepreneurial. Oil and water.

discovery.text: Incompatible network technologies meant customers on different systems couldn't even be merged smoothly.

twist.text: Sprint wrote off $29.7 billion within two years â€” nearly the entire value of the Nextel acquisition.

climax.text: Cultural due diligence matters as much as financial due diligence. Ignoring culture kills deals.

punchline.text: Two great companies can make one terrible one if the cultures don't fit.

quiz.question: What was the primary cause of the Sprint-Nextel merger failure?
options: Incompatible cultures and technologies that couldn't be merged
The market for mobile phones collapsed
